abstract: Energy experts urged nations to move swiftly away from the use of coal and provide new options for the two billion people who still mostly cook in the dark on wood or dung fires.
snippet: Energy experts urged nations to move swiftly away from the use of coal and provide new options for the two billion people who still mostly cook in the dark on wood or dung fires.
lead_paragraph: Energy experts convened by the world’s scientific academies yesterday urged nations to shift swiftly away from coal and other fuels that are the main source of climate-warming greenhouse gases and to provide new energy options for the two billion people who still mostly cook in the dark on wood or dung fires.

headline.main: Panel Urges Global Shift on Sources of Energy
headline.print_headline: Panel Urges Global Shift On Sources Of Energy

abstract: Although Bear Stearns investors want to see the firm increase its international exposure, there is uncertainty as to whether the Citic deal will contribute to earnings.
snippet: Although Bear Stearns investors want to see the firm increase its international exposure, there is uncertainty as to whether the Citic deal will contribute to earnings.
lead_paragraph: When James E. Cayne, 73, the chief executive of Bear Stearns, flew to Beijing over the Labor Day weekend to discuss a partnership with Citic Securities, China’s largest investment bank, the two firm’s fortunes were diverging.

headline.main: Ailing Firm Gets Tonic From China
headline.print_headline: Ailing Firm Gets Tonic From China
